intro: Sticherus squamulosus, commonly known as the scaly sticherus, is a small, perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the family Pterobryaceae. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and dense, overlapping leaves that are often covered in a layer of fine, scale-like structures. The plant produces small, greenish to brownish spore capsules that are clustered in tufts, typical of many mosses and related species. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forests or on rocky substrates. Its botanical features make it an important component of certain ecosystems, contributing to soil stability and microhabitat diversity.
